definition[0]: a large amount of something such as letters or questions that someone gets at the same time
example[0]: Viewers sent a deluge of complaints about the show.
definition[1]: a large flood, or period when there is a lot of rain
definition[2]: to send a very large number of letters, questions etc to someone all at the same time
example[1]: He was deluged with phone calls from friends and colleagues, congratulating him.
explanation[0]: Deluge is usually passive in this meaning
definition[3]: to cover something with a lot of water
